channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9347] Support for enabling servlet filters for REST service
item.description: Currently there is no support for specifying filters for filtering client requests. It will be useful if filters can be configured through hbase configuration.
item.summary: Support for enabling servlet filters for REST service

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Initial draft of the patch.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12600069/HBASE-9347_94.00.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 7 new or modified tests.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6912//console

This message is automatically generated.

Looks reasonable.

Although, we are starting to dup what is normally done with servlet container configuration and WAR manifests. Should we bring back the WAR packaging target?

Andrew Purtell Agreed the above config should ideally go into servlet container configuration. But since this is the only one config now, in my opinion lets keep it in hbase-site.xml. If we start seeing too many of these in hbase-site.xml, then create a WAR packaging target.
Andrew Purtell – Can you take a look at the latest patch ? Thanks!.
Vandana Ayyalasomayajula please provide a patch vs trunk.
Patch for trunk.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

This message is automatically generated.
Updating title. Previous title was confusing, considering HBASE-9345.
Since it's now entirely configurable, the GzipFilter should be moved out into hbase-default.xml, giving the user full flexibility in overriding it if they desire.

Since it's now entirely configurable, the GzipFilter should be moved out into hbase-default.xml, giving the user full flexibility in overriding it if they desire.

+1

This message is automatically generated.
Fixed the failing unit test.

You should update hbase-default.xml to define a value for hbase.rest.filter.classes containing GZipFilter so that the default behavior remains consistent for users. You can then simplify TestGzipFilter to verify the filter's presence. Looking good otherwise.
Nick Dimiduk Can you review the latest patch ? HadoopQA run did not get triggered after I attached the patch.

+1

Now let's get a build-bot run with some green lights.
poke.

Fixed find bugs warning.
What's with adding, removing, adding the tests here? Was the previous omission intentional?
Which tests are you referring ? I removed a log message which was causing the find bugs warning.

Which tests are you referring ?

Patch 02 introduces DummyFilter and TestResourceFilter. Patches 03 and 04 omit them. Patch 05 introduces them again.
Sorry for the omission. Please consider only the 05 patch.

Sounds good.

Let's get a green light from the buildbot. Assuming green, and unless there are any objections, I'll commit this later today or tomorrow.
poking buildbot.
